Dear Ms. VanLuven:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
07/31/2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was informed that DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS
Policy. DCWL Consultants will only be auditing those rules described in
the "Licensing Rules for Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting
that the foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and
other relevant parities and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan
would meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
2

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual policy is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 6-5-2024 in response to
those policy violations established during the renewal audit completed on 5-9-
2025. The violations are as follows: FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans, FOM 722-
06B Family Team Meeting, FOM 722-06H Case Contacts, and FOM 810-03
Medical Passports. The current interim inspection did not establish repeat
violations indicating the CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was reviewed. The report
documents that the agency reviewed their 2024 CAP and implemented corrective
actions by 7-8-24. The assessment identified various barriers to rule compliance
such as the lack of readily available medical services within the primary service
delivery area. Other barriers include absent or AWOL parents and homeless
parents making it difficult to conduct reunification efforts. The agency has
experienced other barriers however staff retention is not one of them. Some staff
are new and learning which can impact compliance, however there is a solid team
in place.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted a budget for the year as well as a certified public
accountant audit of the agency. There were no financial concerns identified.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling like they are members of a supportive foster
care team. Staff reported they can rely on each other when needed. Staff also
reported their respective supervisors are supportive and readily available for
assistance when needed. Staff further reported their supervisors are
knowledgeable and provide consultation when requested.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is in a modern building located on tribal property. There is sufficient
office space. There is a spacious lobby and a receptionist to assist the public
seeking services. No concerns were observed.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
3

The CPA Analyst identified one safety alert during her visits to the homes. The safety
alert is as follows:
Safety Alert #1. The safety alert was generated on 3-20-2025 as the home did not have
a carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 3-24-2025 as a carbon monoxide detector
was installed and verifying photos provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
August 5, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 7, 2025
